2022-03-18.name: St. Patrick's Day Festival
2022-03-18.summary: In northwest Iowa, this is the state's Irish capital, and it celebrates with many festivities, including a parade at 1:30 p.m. Saturday.

2022-03-19.name: St. Patrick's Day Festival
2022-03-19.summary: In northwest Iowa, this is the state's Irish capital, and it celebrates with many festivities, including a parade at 1:30 p.m. Saturday.

2022-03-19.name: Celtic Fest
2022-03-19.summary: This free festival at the Hjemkomst Center includes two entertainment stages, heritage programs, arts and crafts, interactive booths and Celtic food and treats.

2022-03-19.summary: St. Patrick's Day parades and celebrations are back, but check for last-minute changes.

2022-03-19.name: St. Patrick's Day Parade & Celebration
2022-03-19.summary: This Brainerd Lakes town celebrates with a parade and party.

2022-03-03.name: Oneota Film Festival
2022-03-03.summary: This free festival showcases documentary films and includes dance performances on the campus of Luther College.

2022-03-04.name: Winter Festival
2022-03-04.summary: The Lake Superior festival features a candlelight ski/snowshoe, polar plunge, botany hike, ice-rescue demo and whitefish-liver feed.

2022-03-04.name: World's Longest Weenie Roast
2022-03-04.summary: Lakewoods Resorts hosts this benefit on Lake Namekagon, which includes snowmobile speed runs, ice bowling, a weenie-eating contest and a frozen weenie polar plunge.

2022-03-05.name: Bock Fest
2022-03-05.summary: There's a parade of mythical Germanic characters, a hunt for billy-goat heads on the Schell Brewery grounds and beyond and a big party afterward with beer, live music and a bonfire.

2022-03-25.name: Restaurant Week
2022-03-25.summary: Time to pack on the calories: More than 370 restaurants offer three-course prix-fixe menus for $25 at brunch or lunch and $39 or $55 at dinner.

2022-03-31.name: Minneapolis/St. Paul International Film Festival
2022-03-31.summary: More than 250 films from more than 70 countries will be shown, based at the five screens of St. Anthony Main, across the river from downtown.

2022-03-12.name: St. Patrick's Day celebrations
2022-03-12.summary: St. Patrick's Day parades and celebrations are back, but check for last-minute changes.

2022-03-12.name: St. Patrick's Day parade
2022-03-12.summary: The big parade starts at noon, starting at Third and Wisconsin downtown and followed by music, dancing and pipes and drums at the Irish Cultural and Heritage Center.

2022-03-12.name: St. Urho's Day
2022-03-12.summary: This North Shore village near Tettegouche State Park celebrates the Finnish saint with a tug-of-war over the Baptism River and a parade, craft fair, music and children's games.

2022-03-17.name: Minneapolis St. Patrick's Day Parade
2022-03-17.summary: This year, the parade again moves to this northern suburb and will be a drive-by parade at 6 p.m.

2022-03-13.name: Dog Days of Winter
2022-03-13.summary: On Poplar Lake in the Central Gunflint, the Trail Center is hosting a sled-dog derby, skijoring races, a bonfire and s'mores.
